Key Arguments: The submission aligns with the views of the Children's Health Defense - Australia Chapter, which opposes the bill.
The author argues that the bill threatens free speech and democratic principles, drawing parallels to the First Amendment of the United States Constitution.
The author believes that government censorship is more harmful than misinformation or disinformation.
The submission suggests that the bill is a reaction to media coverage during the COVID pandemic and dismisses the justification as based on logical fallacies.
Main Themes: Criticism of media influence and COVID-19 related misinformation narratives
Notable Quotes: Any censorship would cause more harm to those citizens and their liberty, than any caused by the dissemination of misinformation or disinformation, whatever that may be.
Accordingly, if Australia is to remain a democratic nation, I reject the need for such amendments as the Bill proposes, and call for this Bill to be dropped altogether.
The perceived need for this Bill seems to be prompted by the media (all types) coverage of the COVID pandemic.
